basics.name: Ethan Garcia
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2028.

work.summary: SWE Intern creating programs for satellites
highlights: Simulated orbital maneuvers, including Hohmann transfers and inclination changes
Model satellite behavior and visualize orbital data
Developed tools for collision avoidance and threat detection
Designed and trained YOLO object detection models for identifying ASAT(anti-satellite launchers
Collaborated with a team to recreate and modernize UI screens for the game
Designed and implemented interactive buttons and menus to improve usability
Developed wireframes and layouts to align with gameplay needs and user experience best practices
Worked in a team-based, iterative design process to refine visuals and functionalityContributed

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
